servinfo.title: Ignition System Construction
servinfo.ptxt: The N32A engine uses an electronic ignition system ignition system that has neither distributor nor high-tension cords. It consists of the following:

item.ptxt: ECM monitors engine and vehicle conditions through the signals from the relevant sensors, determines the most suitable ignition timing and sends correct signals to ignition coil assemblies.

The ignition coil assembly is a combination of an ignitor and ignition coils. It is provided for each cylinder and the ignition coils fit directly over each spark plug. The current to the primary coil is turned on and off according to signal from the ECM. When the current flowing through the primary coil is broken, a high voltage is induced in the secondary coil. The high voltage is applied directly to the spark plug of each cylinder.

ptxt.emph: CMP (Camshaft position) sensor and CKP (Crankshaft position) sensor

item.ptxt: Using signals from these sensors, ECM identifies a specific cylinder whose piston is in the compression stroke, detects the crank angle and adjusts the initial ignition timing automatically.
ECM optimally controls the ignition timing also using signals from other sensors/switches in addition to signals from CMP and CKP sensors
